page.title: 08BISHOP OF HEREFORD'S SCHOOL
page.content: The Bishop of Hereford's Bluecoat School or "Bishop's" as it is affectionately known is a Church of England Comprehensive school. It was founded in 1973 when "comprehensive" plans were implemented in the City of Hereford, with the amalgamation of two secondary modern schools - Bishop's and The Bluecoat School. The School boasts excellent facilities with many new buildings. Science laboratories, the metalwork, engineering and pottery rooms are reckoned to be the best in the County. Pride is also taken in the sport's complex and the large library. Children of 11-16 are catered for and 'church places' are reserved for children living outside the normal catchment area. The school enjoys its academic success and its good reputation for Sport, Drama, and Music.
